cms:local-dependency.cms:description: Deploy server is generic server component that hosts several components used to deploy configuration to various MC systems
Call Trace Server (QXTS) provides Call Trace Client (QCT) with correlated calls, transactions and session

cms:activities.cms:epr: protocol restarts observed for ldap 3.1.0
LinuxProbeInfo method of determining machine primary IP address is unreliable
NTP alarm
disk compression should be enabled by default
At MTEL, the probe BL-PS2 has a big file qmpa5.log (150MB) with huge number of warnings
li-usim-ip 11.0.8
selfmon script - simHealth should not check memory and CPU
qmpa5 not generating stack when protcol crash occurs
Wrong MSISDN filling
Segm fault in HTable.cpp:60
Gb deciphering fails after return from IUPS

cms:activities.cms:enh: Protocols - 64bit architecture migration is FCA for MasterClaw 7.0.2
cms:activities.cms:epr: Gb deciphereging failure for double-XID
Gb deciphering fails if sequence starts with PAGING
Gb deciphering fails after return from IUPS
GB deciphering not working with LowestLayers=ETH_MAC
"Invalid filter received" - qmpa5.log flooded and /var/log partition filled to 100% very quickly
couple selfmon checks are not working
Probe was crashed
Gb deciphering low
Uninstall script crashes
x logfile shows SIP-Expander FID 478 Index below SIP FID 534
IMSI not filled for SUSPEND/RESUME transactions
Complex IMS Call Inprogress Query causes sip protocol server restarts on all probes
IMSI updates not happening properly
IMSI not filled by key server
x sm update - crashed CT9 probe
Not possible to disable deciphering alarm
qmpa5 crashes in probe
lock input connectors and apply new snapshot
Segmentation fault in x eventsrc write
One paging CSDR processed by two prot_servers
no point code info included in DUNA/DAVA alarms
Warning in qmpa5.log when starting GTP capture
selfmon disabled by default
Selfmon qmpa protosHealth shows [p176064_f] Health CRITICAL
probeInfo does not run through in Booster and Cooperation Group with sec linux active
Health field not filled in selfmon protocol_servers message for 64bit protocols
Malformed output for gbDeciph info in selfmon
X CST does not show correct statistics for H248 - FID480
qmpa protosHealth - protocol health - WARNING (CPU and memory process lifetime average returned by ps replaced with short average returned by top)
Source IP of 1st Leg differs to Source IP Address in Message pane of eoF (The bug was discovered in parsing of CSDR filter that modified the CSDR.)
browsing for one FID is getting stuck
Probe restarted - Error: e->m_eventType == sLUP_EVENT::ePDU
x command does not show/work the Cellid and PagingInfo options

cms:activities.cms:enh: Paging in GB - GB distribution (Parallel setting for GB protocol on links with key server configured now distributes GB traffic based on session IMSI tracking to protocol servers.)
cms:activities.cms:epr: qmpa5 not restarted after core dump caused by disk io errors (Additional log is added at the end of runMPA script to be able to check if it has terminated. Additional flags added at several commands after core dump should make sure they do not hang.)
Source IP of 1st Leg differs to Source IP Address in Message pane of eoF (The bug was discovered in parsing of CSDR filter that modified the CSDR.)

29 Signalling Probes crashed - shutdown by watchdog (The while loop parsing CSDR filters was missing break in case the filter exceeded the data buffer size which caused it couldn’t exit and qmpa5 became unresponsive.)
Mpamain memory leak (Small memory leak in qpthreads found and fixed.)
Restarts observed for protocol UMTS_IU-14.0.0 (The qmpa5 part of this problem - assert when protocol reports invalid number of CSDRs was removed. Qmpa5 now ignores invalid null CSDRs.)

"x selfmon" creates more output than expected when scrambling is enabled (Old problem workaround by enabling disabled CSDR layouts in case of scrambling was highlighted by recent introduction of SelfMon support. Now the proper fix is implemented.)
Raw data capturing may fail on booster configuration (Raw data capturing failed on booster configuration in some cases, now fixed)
Selfmon - SIM health CRITICAL (Selfmon evaluation of SIM health – instance names condition corrected.)
qmpa protosHealth - protocol health - WARNING (CPU and memory process lifetime average returned by ps replaced with short average returned by top)
CSDR update reconnecting to probe is not happening properly (Introduced with EPR 34279 fix)
Error Activating Maintenance Scan and Automatic update using Clasic topology (Fixed in new versions)
Data lost which seems to be correlated with Nagios NRPE checks (Selfmon evaluation of link-set names was re-implemented to not retrieve CSLinksets output repeatedly.)
selfmon script - simHealth should not check memory and CPU (Thresholds increased (memory from 10% to 50%, CPU from 50% to 90%).)
CSDR update reconnecting to probe is not happening properly (Introduced with EPR 34279 fix)
Selfmon - SIM health CRITICAL (Selfmon evaluation of SIM health – instance names condition corrected.)
qmpa protosHealth - protocol health - WARNING (CPU and memory process lifetime average returned by ps replaced with short average returned by top)
Data lost which seems to be correlated with Nagios NRPE checks (Selfmon evaluation of link-set names was re-implemented to not retrieve CSLinksets output repeatedly.)
Error Activating Maintenance Scan and Automatic update using Clasic topology (Fixed in new versions)

64bit Gb Deciphering zeroes ciphered part of PDU on first unsuccessful deciphering attempt which impacts success rate (A bug specific to 64bit qmpa5 versions fixed by not using repeated call of GEA algorithm for reverting back the changes made in PDU by failed deciphering attempt.)
Inconsistent IMSI filling in S1 CSDRs (A bug in qmpa5 update request re-syncing after timeouts could cause loss of more updates than those timeout-ed by EPR_34366 fault of info-server.)
nin file contains index with same name but different definition (Qmpa5 must support indexes with same name if they belong to different CSDR layouts.)
wrong IMSI assigned (Part of deciphering and GB update fixes. TLLI is used with RAI as unique search key in qmpa5, in specific cases BVCI is used.)
Gb deciphering - connections on different BVCI confusing IOVUI (Part of deciphering and GB update fixes. TLLI is used with RAI as unique search key in qmpa5, in specific cases BVCI is used.)
IMSI is not filled in some cases (Part of deciphering and GB update fixes. TLLI is used with RAI as unique search key in qmpa5, in specific cases BVCI is used.)
gb deciphering values fluctuating (Part of deciphering and GB update fixes. TLLI is used with RAI as unique search key in qmpa5, in specific cases BVCI is used.)
incorrect IMEISV filling on IuPS (Part of deciphering and GB update fixes. TLLI is used with RAI as unique search key in qmpa5, in specific cases BVCI is used.)
Low Gb deciphering ratio (Part of deciphering and GB update fixes. TLLI is used with RAI as unique search key in qmpa5, in specific cases BVCI is used.)

cms:activities.cms:enh: Paging Handling (New feature to drop unwanted Paging messages from Event Log of the probe.)
cms:activities.cms:epr: x perf hist gives wrong values (Values in x perf hist output weren't in accordance with x perf command (2.9Mbps vs 29Mbs).)
probe alarms (Alarms QMPA_OVERFLOW and NTP_ALARM were populated in the Alarm Manager after the migration to 6.4.2 even though they don't correspond to the actual state.)
CSDR index does not find CSDR with BCD number ending with F (The 'F' from BCD number was not stripped when building index.)
selfmon script does not return pid (Mpamains pid was missing in selfmon output.)
when selfmon disabled, selfmon script gets blocked (selfmon-status-qmpa5 was not able to detect missing "x selfmon".)
qmpa5 crashed with stackdump (New “inprogress” command introduced to avoid application freezing by “icsdrlog” command.)

cms:activities.cms:enh: LinuxProbeInfo.sh script collects FBC configuration (LinuxProbeInfo.sh script now includes FBC configuration file if such exists)
cms:activities.cms:epr: popen() calls possibly threaten severe slowdown (The use of pipe and dynamically forked sub-process replaced with regular file maintained by permanently running script also for SelfMon.)
qmpa5 restarted (Issue related to EPR#34014 from CN lab was reported also from T&Q.)
Random crashes on lab CT9 (Random crashes on CT9 were caused by setting invalid page size (too large) to prot_serv for CSDR reference to PDU truncation.)
qmpa5 writes uninitialized data after compressed block (Qmpa5 wrote uninitialized data after compressed block for 4K alignment.)
get csdrinfo missing for VoipCSDR=1 With setting VoioCSDR=1 the negotiation of RTP_STAT FID is missing from qmpa5 side. This may result in wrong chosen layout.)
incomplete list of channels reported to selfmon (The mistake was that selfmon printed only SI's having prot serv.)
x perf reported DataLost below 90Mbps (Further much less significant data loses were triggered by issue tracked in EPR#33467.)
prot_servs generate core file into small /var/log (Prot_serv default CWD changed to data subdirectory.)
core reduction sometimes hangs (Core reduction feature as implemented in 5.0.4 sometimes hangs on 32bit as well as on 64bit platform when unmaping regions of memory.)
possible slowdown on NTP_ALARM (The use of pipe and dynamically forked sub-process replaced with regular file maintained by permanently running script.)
executing x in x commands - error output (Usage hints corrected.)
probeInfo for coop groups contains two time li-ether-sim.log (Couple of LinuxProbeInfo.sh fixes.)
performance-protocol abort (Warning: HandleProcessEvents took... (Considered caused by EPR#33504 design issue.)

qmpa5 killed by watchdog (This is browsing performance optimizations design issue present in both 4.2.x and 5.0.x branches causing insufficient memory for cache problems leading into (sometimes temporary) fatal performance degradation.)
x perf reported DataLost below 90Mbps (Considered caused by EPR#33504 design issue.)
generation does not start if the number of csdr fields > 184 (Condition fixed.)
infinitely increasing memory allocation (Considered caused by EPR#33504 design issue.)
xdr generator stopped (So far not the fix but additional logging as attempt to progress with investigation.)
../logfile/LogCache3.cpp line 516 no cache memory assertion (Improvement of fix provided in qmpa5-5.0.5)
../logfile/LogCache3.cpp line 516 no cache memory assertion (Fixed by removing the periodicity of swap adjustment evaluation that could lead into LogFile cache memory uncontrolled allocation.)
Assertion after ProtServ Launch failed on fork error (Fixed the incomplete cleanup of prot_serv structures when fork() failed.)
hanging qmpa5 on ct9 (libstdc++-v3/libsupc++/eh_terminate.cc:47) (This is problem of C++ 3.0.4 runtime unable to unwind stack for exceptions - fixed by disabling inline functions for 32bit build.)
xkr::hash_log2 (Corruption of log file even the recovery passes all check sums is correctly handled now by new partition start and error report.)

voip probe found frozen (Investigated directly on probe and there was a race condition between "x csdrlog" command that prints status of browsers and update of browsers in CSDRServ2 ClientFilter=3 handling.)

cms:activities.cms:enh: ICSDR BulkChange (There is a new method to remove, update or add number of ICSDR filters at the same time.)
Increase number of ICSDR browsers to 64
cms:activities.cms:epr: processing probe in cooperation group stopped working (Fixing the backtrace.kill script wrong calling path introduced with 64bit qmpa5. The root cause for “hanging” is hidden by backtrace.kill not started but may be equal to EPR_33367. In any case the hanging events processing probe will be re-started now as appropriate.)
Probe hangs, e.g x commands never returned (Duplicate of EPR #33106)

Selfmon: some parameters not shown in txt format (Remaining part of the fix, the csdrs/current_browsers and csdrs/current_i_browsers weren’t filled in case of CSDR missing FID name, is already confirmed by T&Q.)
Gb data ciphered even when key is available (Serious problem in GEA (de)ciphering algorithm implementation when both input and output buffers used the same memory location.)

Memory problem in QMPA5 64 bit version (Original expectation that 31918 fix of problem with multiple FID fixes also this was wrong. This was separate problem in TMSI_IMSI CSDR update module introduced with ClientFilter CSDR browsing performance improvements. The clearing of CSDR flags (reusing former interpretation ID) is fixed now.)
probe restart - error - m_browser2->m_file_browser
probe hung - ./bin/backtrace.kill: No such file or directory
cLOG_TABLE2::PutEvent(cCSDR32) seg.fault crashes of qmpa5
x csl does not show statistics - x csrs does
protocol inspect does not work (Bug in PA interface fixed)
traces wo index may cause qxts emergency state
Assertion `m_write_pages.size() == m_partition

cms:activities.cms:enh: CSDRindex and FieldSelection (Part of ECR1279: CSDRindex and FieldSelection tasks in CNCZ. Refer to section 9 for more details.)
